definitions.text: education imparted in a series of lessons or meetings
examples: he took a course in basket weaving
flirting is not unknown in college classes

definitions.text: a connected series of events or actions or developments
examples: the government took a firm course
historians can only point out those lines for which evidence is available
the river takes a southern course
the northeastern trend of the coast
if you persist in that course you will surely fail
once a nation is embarked on a course of action it becomes extremely difficult for any retraction to take place

definitions.text: a line or route along which something travels or moves
examples: the hurricane demolished houses in its path
the track of an animal
the course of the river

definitions.text: a body of students who are taught together
examples: early morning classes are always sleepy

definitions.text: part of a meal served at one time
examples: she prepared a three course meal
a course of bricks

definitions.text: facility consisting of a circumscribed area of land or water laid out for a sport
examples: the course had only nine holes
the course was less than a mile
ships coursing the Atlantic
Water flowed into the cave
the Missouri feeds into the Mississippi
He often courses hares
naturally, the lawyer sent us a huge bill
